abstract.text: A container that groups your list items into sections.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A section contains zero or more list items. You can configure a section to display a header and a section index title, which CarPlay displays on the trailing edge of the screen. The section header and the section index title are optional.
To create a section, call the
method and provide an array of list items. Alternatively, use
if you want to display a header and a section index title. CarPlay doesn’t support custom list items, so you must use one of the types that the framework provides, such as
to determine the maximum number of sections that your list can display. When creating items for your sections, use
to establish the maximum number of items across all sections that can appear in your list.

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
A list template row that displays a series of images.
A selectable row in a list template.
A container that groups your list items into sections.
The section’s header text.
A button that the section header displays.
An image that the section header displays.
A string that the header displays as a subtitle.
Returns the index of the specified item.
Creates a section with list items, a header, a section index title, and section header details.
Creates a section with list items.
Creates a section with list items, a header, and a section index title.
Returns the item at the specified index.
The list of items for the section.
The section’s index title.
The maximum number of items, across all sections, that the template can display.
The maximum number of sections that the template can display.
The number of sections in the list.
The sections that the list displays.
Adds, removes, reorders, or updates the list’s sections.
A description of the common properties of all list item types.
A list template row that represents a conversation or contact.
A description of a selectable list item.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
